**Title:** ConductingEquipment

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |

**Description:** The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

| Property                                           | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition                      | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| -------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [EnergyConnection](#EnergyConnection )           | No      | object | No         | In ./EnergyConnection.json      | A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - [ACDCConverter](#ACDCConverter )                 | No      | object | No         | In ./ACDCConverter.json         | A unit with valves for three phases, together with unit control equipment, essential protective and switching devices, DC storage capacitors, phase reactors and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| - [EquivalentEquipment](#EquivalentEquipment )     | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentEquipment.json   | The class represents equivalent objects that are the result of a network reduction. The class is the base for equivalent objects of different types.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| - [Connector](#Connector )                         | No      | object | No         | In ./Connector.json             | A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| - [Conductor](#Conductor )                         | No      | object | No         | In ./Conductor.json             | Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| - [EarthFaultCompensator](#EarthFaultCompensator ) | No      | object | No         | In ./EarthFaultCompensator.json | A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults.   An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground.  If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - [Clamp](#Clamp )                                 | No      | object | No         | In ./Clamp.json                 | A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. <br />A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - [SeriesCompensator](#SeriesCompensator )         | No      | object | No         | In ./SeriesCompensator.json     | A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance.  It is a two terminal device.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| - [Ground](#Ground )                               | No      | object | No         | In ./Ground.json                | A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - [Switch](#Switch )                               | No      | object | No         | In ./Switch.json                | A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - [PowerTransformer](#PowerTransformer )           | No      | object | No         | In ./PowerTransformer.json      | An electrical device consisting of  two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow).<br />A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical.<br />A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations.   A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals.<br />The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used.  The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead. |

| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| - [StaticVarCompensator](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator )             | No      | object | No         | In ./StaticVarCompensator.json       | A facility for providing variable and controllable shunt reactive power. The SVC typically consists of a stepdown transformer, filter, thyristor-controlled reactor, and thyristor-switched capacitor arms.<br /><br />The SVC may operate in fixed MVar output mode or in voltage control mode. When in voltage control mode, the output of the SVC will be proportional to the deviation of voltage at the controlled bus from the voltage setpoint.  The SVC characteristic slope defines the proportion.  If the voltage at the controlled bus is equal to the voltage setpoint, the SVC MVar output is zero. |
| - [ExternalNetworkInjection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection )     | No      | object | No         | In ./ExternalNetworkInjection.json   | This class represents the external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - [FrequencyConverter](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_FrequencyConverter )                 | No      | object | No         | In ./FrequencyConverter.json         | A device to convert from one frequency to another (e.g., frequency F1 to F2) comprises a pair of FrequencyConverter instances. One converts from F1 to DC, the other converts the DC to F2.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| - [ShuntCompensator](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator )                     | No      | object | No         | In ./ShuntCompensator.json           | A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor. A negative value for bPerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device.  Ground is implied.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| - [RotatingMachine](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine )                       | No      | object | No         | In ./RotatingMachine.json            | A rotating machine which may be used as a generator or motor.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.1.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_ACDCTerminalconnected"></a>1.1.1.3.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > ACDCTerminal.connected`

**Title:** connected

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The connected status is related to a bus-branch model and the topological node to terminal relation.  True implies the terminal is connected to the related topological node and false implies it is not. 
In a bus-branch model, the connected status is used to tell if equipment is disconnected without having to change the connectivity described by the topological node to terminal relation. A valid case is that conducting equipment can be connected in one end and open in the other. In particular for an AC line segment, where the reactive line charging can be significant, this is a relevant case.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_Terminalphases"></a>1.1.1.3.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > Terminal.phases`

**Title:** phases

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./PhaseCode.json   |

**Description:** Represents the normal network phasing condition. If the attribute is missing, three phases (ABC) shall be assumed, except for terminals of grounding classes (specializations of EarthFaultCompensator, GroundDisconnector, and Ground) which will be assumed to be N. Therefore, phase code ABCN is explicitly declared when needed, e.g. for star point grounding equipment.
The phase code on terminals connecting same ConnectivityNode or same TopologicalNode as well as for equipment between two terminals shall be consistent.

Must be one of:
* "ABCN"
* "ABC"
* "ABN"
* "ACN"
* "BCN"
* "AB"
* "AC"
* "BC"
* "AN"
* "BN"
* "CN"
* "A"
* "B"
* "C"
* "N"
* "s1N"
* "s2N"
* "s12N"
* "s1"
* "s2"
* "s12"
* "none"
* "X"
* "XY"
* "XN"
* "XYN"

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_ACDCTerminalsequenceNumber"></a>1.1.1.3.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > ACDCTerminal.sequenceNumber`

**Title:** sequenceNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The orientation of the terminal connections for a multiple terminal conducting equipment.  The sequence numbering starts with 1 and additional terminals should follow in increasing order.   The first terminal is the "starting point" for a two terminal branch.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.3.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.3.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.3.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.3.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.Terminals > Terminal > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitstoredE"></a>1.1.1.4.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > BatteryUnit.storedE`

**Title:** storedE

|                        |                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [BatteryUnit.ratedE](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE) |

**Description:** Amount of energy currently stored. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero and lower than BatteryUnit.ratedE.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.4.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.4.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.4.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge"></a>1.1.1.4.1.8. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge_multiplier"></a>1.1.1.4.1.8.1. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge_unit"></a>1.1.1.4.1.8.2. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitbatteryState"></a>1.1.1.4.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > BatteryUnit.batteryState`

**Title:** batteryState

|                |                         |
| -------------- | ----------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`      |
| **Required**   | No                      |
| **Defined in** | ./BatteryStateKind.json |

**Description:** The current state of the battery (charging, full, etc.).

Must be one of:
* "discharging"
* "waiting"
* "full"
* "empty"
* "charging"

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.4.1.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.4.1.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.4.1.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.4.1.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.4.1.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > BatteryUnit > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i1_PhotoVoltaicUnitGenerationProfile"></a>1.1.1.4.2.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PhotoVoltaicUnit > PhotoVoltaicUnit.GenerationProfile`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i1_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.4.2.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PhotoVoltaicUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.4.2.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PhotoVoltaicUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.4.2.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PhotoVoltaicUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2"></a>1.1.1.4.3. | - [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP )                                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP ) | maxP                   |
| - [PowerElectronicsUnit.minP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_PowerElectronicsUnitminP )                                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP ) | minP                   |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_PowerElectronicsWindUnitGenerationProfile"></a>1.1.1.4.3.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > PowerElectronicsWindUnit.GenerationProfile`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.4.3.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.4.3.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.4.3.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP"></a>1.1.1.4.3.5. | **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Maximum active power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.4.3.7. |              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.4.3.8. **Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.4.3.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.4.3.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i2_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.4.3.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsUnit > oneOf > PowerElectronicsWindUnit > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase"></a>1.1.1.6.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase > PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase > PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                |                        |
| -------------- | ---------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`     |
| **Required**   | No                     |
| **Defined in** | ./SinglePhaseKind.json |

**Description:** Phase of this energy producer component.   If the energy producer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy producer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy producer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

Must be one of:
* "A"
* "B"
* "C"
* "N"
* "s1"
* "s2"

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasep"></a>1.1.1.6.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase > PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase > PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow into the equipment from the network.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus_items_SvStatusinService"></a>1.1.1.7.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.SvStatus > SvStatus > SvStatus.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The in service status as a result of topology processing.  It indicates if the equipment is considered as energized by the power flow. It reflects if the equipment is connected within a solvable island.  It does not necessarily reflect whether or not the island was solved by the power flow.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus_items_SvStatusphase"></a>1.1.1.7.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > ConductingEquipment.SvStatus > SvStatus > SvStatus.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** The individual phase status.    If the attribute is unspecified, then three phase model is assumed.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_RegulatingCondEqcontrolEnabled"></a>1.1.1.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > RegulatingCondEq.controlEnabled`

**Title:** controlEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionmaxIFault"></a>1.1.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.maxIFault`

| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./PU.json          |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionp"></a>1.1.1.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionq"></a>1.1.1.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.q`

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr"></a>1.1.1.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > PowerElectronicsConnection.r`

**Title:** r

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./Resistance.json  |

**Description:** Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.27. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.28. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.29. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > PowerElectronicsConnection > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator"></a>1.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./StaticVarCompensator.json                                               |

**Description:** A facility for providing variable and controllable shunt reactive power. The SVC typically consists of a stepdown transformer, filter, thyristor-controlled reactor, and thyristor-switched capacitor arms.

The SVC may operate in fixed MVar output mode or in voltage control mode. When in voltage control mode, the output of the SVC will be proportional to the deviation of voltage at the controlled bus from the voltage setpoint.  The SVC characteristic slope defines the proportion.  If the voltage at the controlled bus is equal to the voltage setpoint, the SVC MVar output is zero.

| Property                                                                                                                                 | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                   | Title/Description      |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_PowerSystemResourceLocation )                   | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                            | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                            | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )                 | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                            | Terminal               |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                            | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )                   | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                            | SvStatus               |
| - [StaticVarCompensator.sVCControlMode](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorsVCControlMode )     | No      | enum (of string) | No         | In ./SVCControlMode.json                                                                                                                                                                                     | sVCControlMode         |

| - [StaticVarCompensator.slope](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorslope )                       | No      | object or number | No         | In ./VoltagePerReactivePower.json                                                                                                                                                                            | slope                  |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorsVCControlMode"></a>1.1.2.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.sVCControlMode`

| **Required**   | No                    |
| **Defined in** | ./SVCControlMode.json |

**Description:** SVC control mode.

Must be one of:
* "reactivePower"
* "voltage"

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorvoltageSetPoint"></a>1.1.2.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.voltageSetPoint`

**Title:** voltageSetPoint

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The reactive power output of the SVC is proportional to the difference between the voltage at the regulated bus and the voltage setpoint.  When the regulated bus voltage is equal to the voltage setpoint, the reactive power output is zero.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.2.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.2.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_RegulatingCondEqcontrolEnabled"></a>1.1.2.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > RegulatingCondEq.controlEnabled`

**Title:** controlEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorq"></a>1.1.2.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.2.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_StaticVarCompensator_StaticVarCompensatorslope"></a>1.1.2.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > StaticVarCompensator > StaticVarCompensator.slope`

|                |                                |
| -------------- | ------------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number`             |
| **Required**   | No                             |
| **Defined in** | ./VoltagePerReactivePower.json |

**Description:** The characteristics slope of an SVC defines how the reactive power output changes in proportion to the difference between the regulated bus voltage and the voltage setpoint.
The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD"></a>1.1.3.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.governorSCD`

**Title:** governorSCD

|                |                                |
| -------------- | ------------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number`             |
| **Required**   | No                             |
| **Defined in** | ./ActivePowerPerFrequency.json |

**Description:** Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated.  A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

| Property                                                                                                                    | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                | Title/Description |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectiongovernorSCD_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                         | nan               |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionikSecond"></a>1.1.3.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.ikSecond`

**Title:** ikSecond

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik").  Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent"></a>1.1.3.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent`

**Title:** maxInitialSymShCCurrent

|                |                    |
| -------------- | ------------------ |
| **Type**       | `object or number` |
| **Required**   | No                 |
| **Defined in** | ./CurrentFlow.json |

**Description:** Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

| Property                                                                                                                                | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                | Title/Description |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                         | nan               |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxQ"></a>1.1.3.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxQ`

**Title:** maxQ

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxR0ToX0Ratio"></a>1.1.3.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxR0ToX0Ratio`

**Title:** maxR0ToX0Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxR1ToX1Ratio"></a>1.1.3.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxR1ToX1Ratio`

**Title:** maxR1ToX1Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxZ0ToZ1Ratio"></a>1.1.3.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.maxZ0ToZ1Ratio`

**Title:** maxZ0ToZ1Ratio

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionminInitialSymShCCurrent"></a>1.1.3.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > RegulatingCondEq > ExternalNetworkInjection > ExternalNetworkInjection.minInitialSymShCCurrent`
