### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer"></a>1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `combining`                                                               |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EnergyConsumer.json                                                     |

**Description:** Generic user of energy - a  point of consumption on the power system model.
EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

| One of(Option)                                                   |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ConformLoad.json](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0)    |
| [NonConformLoad.json](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1) |

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0"></a>1.2.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad.json`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ConformLoad.json                                                        |

**Description:** ConformLoad represent loads that follow a daily load change pattern where the pattern can be used to scale the load with a system load.

| Property                                                                                                                           | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_PowerSystemResourceLocation )                           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )                 | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )                         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | Terminal                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - [EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerAction](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerAction )             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic ) | No      | object           | No         | In ./LoadResponseCharacteristic.json                                                                                                                                                                                   | Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.<br />If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.<br />The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. <br />The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: <br />pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent<br />qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent<br />Where: <br />1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";<br />2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.<br />3) After power flow is solved: <br />-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  <br />- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected. |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_IdentifiedObjectname )                                         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | name                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic"></a>1.2.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./LoadResponseCharacteristic.json                                         |

**Description:** Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

| Property                                                                                                                                                                            | Pattern | Type    | Deprecated | Definition | Title/Description  |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------- | ---------- | ---------- | ------------------ |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantCurrent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantCurrent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantCurrent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantImpedance](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantImpedance ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantImpedance |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pConstantPower](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpConstantPower )         | No      | number  | No         | -          | pConstantPower     |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pFrequencyExponent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpFrequencyExponent ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | pFrequencyExponent |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicpVoltageExponent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | pVoltageExponent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantCurrent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantCurrent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantCurrent   |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantImpedance](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantImpedance ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantImpedance |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qConstantPower](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqConstantPower )         | No      | number  | No         | -          | qConstantPower     |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qFrequencyExponent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqFrequencyExponent ) | No      | number  | No         | -          | qFrequencyExponent |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicqVoltageExponent )     | No      | number  | No         | -          | qVoltageExponent   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectname )                                                 | No      | string  | No         | -          | name               |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectdescription )                                   | No      | string  | No         | -          | description        |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )                                       | No      | string  | No         | -          | aliasName          |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectmRID )                                                 | No      | string  | No         | -          | mRID               |
| - [LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicexponentModel )           | No      | boolean | No         | -          | exponentModel      |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.2.1.5.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.2.1.5.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic_LoadResponseCharacteristicexponentModel"></a>1.2.1.5.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic > LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel`

**Title:** exponentModel

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Indicates the exponential voltage dependency model is to be used. If false, the coefficient model is to be used.
The exponential voltage dependency model consist of the attributes:
- pVoltageExponent
- qVoltageExponent
- pFrequencyExponent
- qFrequencyExponent.
The coefficient model consist of the attributes:
- pConstantImpedance
- pConstantCurrent
- pConstantPower
- qConstantImpedance
- qConstantCurrent
- qConstantPower.
The sum of pConstantImpedance, pConstantCurrent and pConstantPower shall equal 1.
The sum of qConstantImpedance, qConstantCurrent and qConstantPower shall equal 1.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.2.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasep"></a>1.2.1.7.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasepfixed"></a>1.2.1.7.1.2. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasepfixedPct"></a>1.2.1.7.1.3. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhasephase"></a>1.2.1.7.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this energy consumer component.   If the energy consumer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy consumer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy consumer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhaseqfixed"></a>1.2.1.7.1.5. ##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhaseqfixedPct"></a>1.2.1.7.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.qfixedPct`

**Title:** qfixedPct

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Fixed reactive power as per cent of load group fixed reactive power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_EnergyConsumerPhaseq"></a>1.2.1.7.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.2.1.7.1.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.2.1.7.1.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.2.1.7.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.2.1.7.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.EnergyConsumerPhase > EnergyConsumerPhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.2.1.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.2.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.2.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.2.1.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.2.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumercustomerCount"></a>1.2.1.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.customerCount`

**Title:** customerCount

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumergrounded"></a>1.2.1.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerpfixed"></a>1.2.1.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixed`

**Title:** pfixed

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerpfixedPct"></a>1.2.1.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixedPct`

| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

**Description:** Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

| - [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic ) | No      | object           | No         | Same as [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic )                                                                               | Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.<br />If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.<br />The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. <br />The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: <br />pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent<br />qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent<br />Where: <br />1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";<br />2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.<br />3) After power flow is solved: <br />-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  <br />- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected. |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic"></a>1.2.2.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic`

|                           |                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                              |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                       |
| **Same definition as**    | [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic) |

**Description:** Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.2.2.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.2.2.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.2.2.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.2.2.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.2.2.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.2.2.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumercustomerCount"></a>1.2.2.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.customerCount`

**Title:** customerCount

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumergrounded"></a>1.2.2.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerpfixed"></a>1.2.2.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixed`

**Description:** Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerpfixedPct"></a>1.2.2.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixedPct`

**Description:** Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.2.2.22. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.2.2.23. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.2.2.24. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.2.2.25. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource"></a>1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EnergySource.json                                                       |

**Description:** A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution voltage level.

| Property                                                                                                | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                   | Title/Description      |

| - [EnergySource.voltageAngle](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle )                 | No      | object or number | No         | In ./AngleRadians.json                                                                                                                                                                                       | voltageAngle           |

| - [EnergySource.x](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcex )                                       | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                                                           | x                      |

| - [EnergySource.xn](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcexn )                                     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                                                           | xn                     |

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |

| **Required** | No      |

| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |

| Each item of this array must be                                                    | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_EnergySourcePhasephase"></a>1.3.7.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this energy source component.   If the energy source wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy source is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy source connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.3.7.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.3.7.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.3.7.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.3.7.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcepMin"></a>1.3.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.pMin`

**Title:** pMin

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** This is the minimum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcereactivePower"></a>1.3.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.reactivePower`

**Title:** reactivePower

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** High voltage source reactive injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.3.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.3.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.3.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentinService"></a>1.3.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle"></a>1.3.22. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.voltageAngle`

**Title:** voltageAngle

|                |                     |
| -------------- | ------------------- |
| **Type**       | `object or number`  |
| **Required**   | No                  |
| **Defined in** | ./AngleRadians.json |

**Description:** Phase angle of a-phase open circuit used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

| Property                                                                            | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                | Title/Description |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |
| - [unit](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle_unit )             | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [unit](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_unit )             | nan               |
| - [value](#EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle_value )           | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                         | nan               |

#### <a name="EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageMagnitude"></a>1.3.23. Property `ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.voltageMagnitude`

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
