#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr"></a>3.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Positive sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr0"></a>3.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r0`

**Title:** r0

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Zero sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr2"></a>3.1.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r2`

**Title:** r2

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Negative sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationCapability"></a>3.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationCapability`

**Title:** regulationCapability

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage. If true the EquivalentInjection can regulate. If false the EquivalentInjection cannot regulate. ReactiveCapabilityCurve can only be associated with EquivalentInjection  if the flag is true.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationStatus"></a>3.1.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationStatus`

**Title:** regulationStatus

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationTarget"></a>3.1.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationTarget`

**Title:** regulationTarget

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The target voltage for voltage regulation. The attribute shall be a positive value.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx"></a>3.1.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x`

**Title:** x

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx0"></a>3.1.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x0`

**Title:** x0

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Zero sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx2"></a>3.1.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x2`

Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>3.1.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionp"></a>3.1.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionq"></a>3.1.21. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Equivalent reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_Equipmentaggregate"></a>3.1.22. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>3.1.23. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>3.1.24. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentinService"></a>3.1.25. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>3.1.26. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>3.1.27. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>3.1.28. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch"></a>3.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EquivalentBranch.json                                                   |

**Description:** The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchnegativeR12"></a>3.2.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.negativeR12`

**Description:** Positive sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchpositiveX12"></a>3.2.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.positiveX12`

**Title:** positiveX12

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchpositiveX21"></a>3.2.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.positiveX21`

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchr"></a>3.2.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Positive sequence series resistance of the reduced branch.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchr21"></a>3.2.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.r21`

**Title:** r21

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.r is given, then EquivalentBranch.r21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.r.
Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchx"></a>3.2.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.x`

**Title:** x

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence series reactance of the reduced branch.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchx21"></a>3.2.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.x21`

**Title:** x21

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represents an unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.x is given, then EquivalentBranch.x21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.x.
Usage rule: EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>3.2.25. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>3.2.26. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentLinehardeningCost"></a>3.2.27. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentLine.hardeningCost`

**Title:** hardeningCost

|                           |                                                                                                                                                   |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                         |
| **Same definition as**    | [GeneratingUnit.startupCost](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_GeneratingUnitstartupCost) |

**Description:** nan

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>3.2.28. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentinService"></a>3.2.29. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>3.2.30. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>3.2.31. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

#### <a name="EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>3.2.32. Property `ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

## <a name="Connector"></a>4. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Connector.json                                                          |

**Description:** A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.

| Property                                                                            | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                               | Title/Description      |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#Connector_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Connector_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#Connector_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | Terminal               |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#Connector_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#Connector_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )           | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | SvStatus               |
| - [BusbarSection.ipMax](#Connector_BusbarSectionipMax )                             | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent ) | ipMax                  |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#Connector_Equipmentaggregate )                             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | aggregate              |
| - [Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled](#Connector_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled )   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | networkAnalysisEnabled |

### <a name="Connector_BusbarSectionipMax"></a>4.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > BusbarSection.ipMax`

**Title:** ipMax

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Maximum allowable peak short-circuit current of busbar (Ipmax in IEC 60909-0). 
Mechanical limit of the busbar in the substation itself. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

### <a name="Connector_Equipmentaggregate"></a>4.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

### <a name="Connector_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>4.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="Connector_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>4.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="Connector_EquipmentinService"></a>4.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="Connector_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>4.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

### <a name="Connector_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>4.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

### <a name="Connector_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>4.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

### <a name="Connector_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>4.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > Connector > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

## <a name="Conductor"></a>5. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Conductor.json                                                          |

**Description:** Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

| Property                                     | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition              | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| -------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [ACLineSegment](#Conductor_ACLineSegment ) | No      | object | No         | In ./ACLineSegment.json | A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.<br />For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.<br />The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch. |
| - [WireSegment](#Conductor_WireSegment )     | No      | object | No         | In ./WireSegment.json   | A two terminal and power conducting device of negligible impedance and length represented as zero impedance device that can be used to connect auxiliary equipment to its terminals.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment"></a>5.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ACLineSegment.json                                                      |

**Description:** A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

| Property                                                                                                        | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                 | Title/Description          |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceLocation )                         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | Terminal                   |
| - [ACLineSegment.PerLengthImpedance](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentPerLengthImpedance )                 | No      | Combination      | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase )                 | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | ACLineSegmentPhase         |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )                   | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [ACLineSegment.WireSpacingInfo](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentWireSpacingInfo )                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [PowerSystemResource.AssetDatasheet](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceAssetDatasheet )             | No      | Combination      | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | -                          |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )                         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | SvStatus                   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectname )                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | name                       |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_Equipmentaggregate )                                           | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | aggregate                  |

| - [Equipment.normallyInService](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService )                           | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | normallyInService          |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )                             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | aliasName                  |

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_ACLineSegmentPhasephase"></a>5.1.5.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_ACLineSegmentPhasesequenceNumber"></a>5.1.5.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber`

**Title:** sequenceNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number designation for this line segment phase. Each line segment phase within a line segment should have a unique sequence number. This is useful for unbalanced modelling to bind the mathematical model (PhaseImpedanceData of PerLengthPhaseImpedance) with the connectivity model (this class) and the physical model (WirePosition) without tight coupling.

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>5.1.5.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>5.1.5.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>5.1.5.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>5.1.5.1.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>5.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>5.1.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

#### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>5.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_Conductorlength"></a>5.1.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Conductor.length`

#### <a name="Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>5.1.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_WireSegmentPhasephase"></a>5.2.5.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase.phase`

**Description:** The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_WireSegmentPhasesequenceNumber"></a>5.2.5.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber`

**Title:** sequenceNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number designation for this wire segment phase. Each wire segment phase within a wire segment should have a unique sequence number.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>5.2.5.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>5.2.5.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>5.2.5.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>5.2.5.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>5.2.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

#### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>5.2.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

#### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>5.2.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentinService"></a>5.2.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="Conductor_WireSegment_Conductorlength"></a>5.2.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Conductor.length`

**Title:** length

|                        |                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

## <a name="EarthFaultCompensator"></a>6. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EarthFaultCompensator.json                                              |

**Description:** A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults.   An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground.  If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

| Property                                                                                        | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                               | Title/Description      |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#EarthFaultCompensator_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#EarthFaultCompensator_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#EarthFaultCompensator_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | Terminal               |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#EarthFaultCompensator_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#EarthFaultCompensator_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )           | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | SvStatus               |
| - [PetersenCoil.xGroundMax](#EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilxGroundMax )                     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                       | xGroundMax             |
| - [PetersenCoil.xGroundMin](#EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilxGroundMin )                     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                       | xGroundMin             |

| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectdescription )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | description            |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#EarthFaultCompensator_Equipmentaggregate )                             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | aggregate              |

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilxGroundNominal"></a>6.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.xGroundNominal`

**Title:** xGroundNominal

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>6.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.
