**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_EquipmentinService"></a>6.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilmode"></a>6.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.mode`

**Title:** mode

|                |                             |
| -------------- | --------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`          |
| **Required**   | No                          |
| **Defined in** | ./PetersenCoilModeKind.json |

**Description:** The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

Must be one of:
* "fixed"
* "manual"
* "automaticPositioning"

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilnominalU"></a>6.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.nominalU`

**Title:** nominalU

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoiloffsetCurrent"></a>6.21. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.offsetCurrent`

**Title:** offsetCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point.  This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative.  Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

### <a name="EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilpositionCurrent"></a>6.22. Property `ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.positionCurrent`

**Title:** positionCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

## <a name="Clamp"></a>7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Clamp.json                                                              |

**Description:** A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. 
A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

| Property                                                                        | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                         | Title/Description      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#Clamp_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Clamp_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | -                      |
| - [Clamp.ClampAction](#Clamp_ClampClampAction )                                 | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#Clamp_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )         | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | Terminal               |
| - [Clamp.ACLineSegment](#Clamp_ClampACLineSegment )                             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#Clamp_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | -                      |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#Clamp_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )           | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | SvStatus               |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#Clamp_Equipmentaggregate )                             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | aggregate              |
| - [Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled](#Clamp_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled )   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | networkAnalysisEnabled |
| - [Clamp.lengthFromTerminal1](#Clamp_ClamplengthFromTerminal1 )                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight ) | lengthFromTerminal1    |
| - [Equipment.normallyInService](#Clamp_EquipmentnormallyInService )             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | normallyInService      |
| - [Equipment.inService](#Clamp_EquipmentinService )                             | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | inService              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#Clamp_IdentifiedObjectdescription )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | description            |

| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#Clamp_IdentifiedObjectname )                         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                  | name                   |

### <a name="Clamp_Equipmentaggregate"></a>7.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

### <a name="Clamp_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>7.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="Clamp_ClamplengthFromTerminal1"></a>7.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Clamp.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the clamp is located starting from side one of the line segment, i.e. the line segment terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

### <a name="Clamp_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>7.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="Clamp_EquipmentinService"></a>7.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="Clamp_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>7.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

### <a name="Clamp_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>7.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

### <a name="Clamp_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>7.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

### <a name="Clamp_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>7.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

**Description:** A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance.  It is a two terminal device.

It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. ### <a name="SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorPresent"></a>8.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent`

**Title:** varistorPresent

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Describe if a metal oxide varistor (mov) for over voltage protection is configured in parallel with the series compensator. It is used for short circuit calculations.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorRatedCurrent"></a>8.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorRatedCurrent`

**Title:** varistorRatedCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The maximum current the varistor is designed to handle at specified duration. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorVoltageThreshold"></a>8.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorVoltageThreshold`

**Title:** varistorVoltageThreshold

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The dc voltage at which the varistor starts conducting. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>8.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>8.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_EquipmentinService"></a>8.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>8.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>8.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>8.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

### <a name="SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>8.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

## <a name="Ground"></a>9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Ground`

**Description:** A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.

### <a name="Ground_Equipmentaggregate"></a>9.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

### <a name="Ground_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>9.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="Ground_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>9.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

## <a name="Switch"></a>10. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Switch.json                                                             |

**Description:** A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

| Property                                                                           | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                               | Title/Description      |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |

| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Switch_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )   | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [Switch.SwitchAction](#Switch_SwitchSwitchAction )                               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |

| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#Switch_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                      |
| - [Switch.SwitchPhase](#Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase )                                 | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | SwitchPhase            |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#Switch_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )             | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | SvStatus               |

| **Defined in**            | ./SwitchPhase.json                                                        |

**Description:** Single phase of a multi-phase switch when its attributes might be different per phase.

##### <a name="Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_SwitchPhasenormalOpen"></a>10.8.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase.normalOpen`

**Title:** normalOpen

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the SwitchPhase has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with this value.

##### <a name="Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_SwitchPhasephaseSide1"></a>10.8.1.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase.phaseSide1`

**Description:** Phase of this SwitchPhase on the side with terminal sequence number equal to 1. Should be a phase contained in that terminals phases attribute.

##### <a name="Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>10.8.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>10.8.1.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>10.8.1.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="Switch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>10.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

### <a name="Switch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>10.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="Switch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>10.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="Switch_CutlengthFromTerminal1"></a>10.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Cut.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

### <a name="Switch_Switchlocked"></a>10.26. Property `ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.locked`

**Title:** locked

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
<ul>
	<li>locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.</li>
</ul>

## <a name="PowerTransformer"></a>11. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./PowerTransformer.json                                                   |

**Description:** An electrical device consisting of  two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow).
A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical.
A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations.   A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals.
The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used.  The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

| Property                                                                                                                               | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                               | Title/Description                      |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------- |
| - [PowerTransformer.TransformerTank](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank )                                               | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | TransformerTank                        |
| - [PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd )                                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | PowerTransformerEnd                    |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#PowerTransformer_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )                                                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | SvStatus                               |
| - [PowerSystemResource.AssetDatasheet](#PowerTransformer_PowerSystemResourceAssetDatasheet )                                           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | -                                      |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent ) | beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU )                             | beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShortCircuitAnglePf](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShortCircuitAnglePf )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                | beforeShortCircuitAnglePf              |
| - [PowerTransformer.highSideMinOperatingU](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerhighSideMinOperatingU )                                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU )                             | highSideMinOperatingU                  |
| - [PowerTransformer.isPartOfGeneratorUnit](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerisPartOfGeneratorUnit )                                   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | isPartOfGeneratorUnit                  |
| - [PowerTransformer.operationalValuesConsidered](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformeroperationalValuesConsidered )                       | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | operationalValuesConsidered            |
| - [PowerTransformer.vectorGroup](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformervectorGroup )                                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | vectorGroup                            |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#PowerTransformer_Equipmentaggregate )                                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | aggregate                              |
| - [Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled](#PowerTransformer_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled )                                               | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | networkAnalysisEnabled                 |
| - [Equipment.normallyInService](#PowerTransformer_EquipmentnormallyInService )                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | normallyInService                      |
| - [Equipment.inService](#PowerTransformer_EquipmentinService )                                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | inService                              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectdescription )                                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | description                            |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )                                                           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | aliasName                              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectmRID )                                                                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | mRID                                   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectname )                                                                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                        | name                                   |

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank"></a>11.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank`

**Title:** TransformerTank

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                 | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [TransformerTank.json](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items) | An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers. |

| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |

**Description:** An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_IdentifiedObjectname )                           | No      | string  | No         | -          | name                   |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd"></a>11.1.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd`

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndendNumber"></a>11.1.1.1.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > TransformerEnd.endNumber`

**Title:** endNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number.  Highest voltage winding should be 1.  Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number.   Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndgrounded"></a>11.1.1.1.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > TransformerEnd.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |

The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>11.1.1.1.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_Equipmentaggregate"></a>11.1.1.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>11.1.1.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>11.1.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_EquipmentinService"></a>11.1.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>11.1.1.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > IdentifiedObject.name`

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd"></a>11.2. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd`

**Title:** PowerTransformerEnd

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer.
The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows.
1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0.  Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage.  In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1.
2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values.
3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1.  This is the preferred way.
4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers.
Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                         | Description                                                                       |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [PowerTransformerEnd.json](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items) | A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer. ... |

#### <a name="autogenerated_heading_65"></a>11.2.1. ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.json

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./PowerTransformerEnd.json                                                |

**Description:** A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer.
The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows.
1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0.  Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage.  In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1.
2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values.
3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1.  This is the preferred way.
4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers.
Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

| Property                                                                                                                                 | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>11.2.1.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                                 | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance"></a>11.2.1.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.MeshImpedance`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./TransformerMeshImpedance.json                                           |

**Description:** Transformer mesh impedance (Delta-model) between transformer ends.
The typical case is that this class describes the impedance between two transformer ends pair-wise, i.e. the cardinalities at both transformer end associations are 1. However, in cases where two or more transformer ends are modelled the cardinalities are larger than 1.

| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [TransformerMeshImpedance.r](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_TransformerMeshImpedancer )     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr ) | r                 |
| - [TransformerMeshImpedance.r0](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_TransformerMeshImpedancer0 )   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr ) | r0                |
| - [TransformerMeshImpedance.x](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_TransformerMeshImpedancex )     | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx ) | x                 |
| - [TransformerMeshImpedance.x0](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_TransformerMeshImpedancex0 )   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx ) | x0                |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectdescription ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | description       |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | aliasName         |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectmRID )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | mRID              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectname )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | name              |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>11.2.1.5.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.MeshImpedance > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>11.2.1.5.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.MeshImpedance > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndMeshImpedance_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>11.2.1.5.8. **Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance"></a>11.2.1.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./TransformerStarImpedance.json                                           |

**Description:** Transformer star impedance (Pi-model) that accurately reflects impedance for transformers with 2 or 3 windings. For transformers with 4 or more windings, TransformerMeshImpedance class shall be used.
For transmission networks use PowerTransformerEnd impedances (r, r0, x, x0, b, b0, g and g0).

| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_IdentifiedObjectmRID )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | mRID              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_IdentifiedObjectname )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                  | name              |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>11.2.1.6.3. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>11.2.1.6.4. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_TransformerStarImpedancer"></a>11.2.1.6.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance > TransformerStarImpedance.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Resistance of the transformer end.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>11.2.1.6.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_TransformerStarImpedancex"></a>11.2.1.6.7. | **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndStarImpedance_TransformerStarImpedancex0"></a>11.2.1.6.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.StarImpedance > TransformerStarImpedance.x0`
