##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance"></a>11.2.1.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.CoreAdmittance`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./TransformerCoreAdmittance.json                                          |

**Description:** The transformer core admittance.  Used to specify the core admittance of a transformer in a manner that can be shared among power transformers.

| Property                                                                                                                                                | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                 | Title/Description |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------- |
| - [TransformerCoreAdmittance.b](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_TransformerCoreAdmittanceb )   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection ) | b                 |
| - [TransformerCoreAdmittance.b0](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_TransformerCoreAdmittanceb0 ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection ) | b0                |
| - [TransformerCoreAdmittance.g](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_TransformerCoreAdmittanceg )   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection ) | g                 |
| - [TransformerCoreAdmittance.g0](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_TransformerCoreAdmittanceg0 ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection ) | g0                |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_IdentifiedObjectdescription ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | description       |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | aliasName         |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_IdentifiedObjectmRID )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | mRID              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_IdentifiedObjectname )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                          | name              |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndCoreAdmittance_TransformerCoreAdmittanceb"></a>11.2.1.7.1. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.CoreAdmittance > TransformerCoreAdmittance.b`

**Title:** b

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndconnectionKind"></a>11.2.1.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.connectionKind`

**Title:** connectionKind

|                |                          |
| -------------- | ------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`       |
| **Required**   | No                       |
| **Defined in** | ./WindingConnection.json |

**Description:** Kind of connection.

Must be one of:
* "D"
* "Y"
* "Z"
* "Yn"
* "Zn"
* "A"
* "I"

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndg"></a>11.2.1.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.g`

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndg0"></a>11.2.1.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.g0`

**Title:** g0

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection) |

**Description:** Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance (star-model).

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndphaseAngleClock"></a>11.2.1.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.phaseAngleClock`

**Title:** phaseAngleClock

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Terminal voltage phase angle displacement where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours. The valid values are 0 to 11. For example, for the secondary side end of a transformer with vector group code of 'Dyn11', specify the connection kind as wye with neutral and specify the phase angle of the clock as 11.  The clock value of the transformer end number specified as 1, is assumed to be zero.  Note the transformer end number is not assumed to be the same as the terminal sequence number.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndr"></a>11.2.1.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than zero for non-equivalent transformers.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndr0"></a>11.2.1.16. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.r0`

**Title:** r0

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Zero sequence series resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndratedS"></a>11.2.1.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.ratedS`

**Title:** ratedS

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedS](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedS) |

**Description:** Normal apparent power rating.
The attribute shall be a positive value. For a two-winding transformer the values for the high and low voltage sides shall be identical.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndratedU"></a>11.2.1.18. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.ratedU`

**Title:** ratedU

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings.
A high voltage side, as given by TransformerEnd.endNumber, shall have a ratedU that is greater than or equal to ratedU for the lower voltage sides.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndx"></a>11.2.1.19. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.x`

**Title:** x

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence series reactance (star-model) of the transformer end.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_PowerTransformerEndx0"></a>11.2.1.20. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd.x0`

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndbmagSat"></a>11.2.1.21. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.bmagSat`

**Title:** bmagSat

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Core shunt magnetizing susceptance in the saturation region.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndendNumber"></a>11.2.1.22. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.endNumber`

**Title:** endNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number.  Highest voltage winding should be 1.  Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number.   Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndgrounded"></a>11.2.1.23. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndmagBaseU"></a>11.2.1.24. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.magBaseU`

**Title:** magBaseU

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The reference voltage at which the magnetizing saturation measurements were made.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndmagSatFlux"></a>11.2.1.25. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.magSatFlux`

**Title:** magSatFlux

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Core magnetizing saturation curve knee flux level.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndrground"></a>11.2.1.26. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.rground`

**Title:** rground

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** (for Yn and Zn connections) Resistance part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_TransformerEndxground"></a>11.2.1.27. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > TransformerEnd.xground`

**Title:** xground

|                        |                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** (for Yn and Zn connections) Reactive part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>11.2.1.28. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>11.2.1.29. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>11.2.1.30. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd > PowerTransformerEnd > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent"></a>11.5. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent`

**Title:** beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The highest operating current (Ib in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit (depends on network configuration and relevant reliability philosophy). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage"></a>11.6. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage`

**Title:** beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The highest operating voltage (Ub in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is worst case voltage on the low side winding (3.7.1 of IEC 60909:2001). Used to define operating conditions.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShortCircuitAnglePf"></a>11.7. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.beforeShortCircuitAnglePf`

**Title:** beforeShortCircuitAnglePf

|                        |                                                                  |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                               |
| **Required**           | No                                                               |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** The angle of power factor before short circuit (phib in IEC 60909-0). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is the worst case power factor. Used to define operating conditions.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerhighSideMinOperatingU"></a>11.8. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.highSideMinOperatingU`

**Title:** highSideMinOperatingU

|                        |                                                                                                                                     |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                  |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                  |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The minimum operating voltage (uQmin in IEC 60909-0) at the high voltage side (Q side) of the unit transformer of the power station unit. A value well established from long-term operating experience of the system. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerisPartOfGeneratorUnit"></a>11.9. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.isPartOfGeneratorUnit`

**Title:** isPartOfGeneratorUnit

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Indicates whether the machine is part of a power station unit. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.  It has an impact on how the correction factors are calculated for transformers, since the transformer is not necessarily part of a synchronous machine and generating unit. It is not always possible to derive this information from the model. This is why the attribute is necessary.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformeroperationalValuesConsidered"></a>11.10. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.operationalValuesConsidered`

**Title:** operationalValuesConsidered

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** It is used to define if the data (other attributes related to short circuit data exchange) defines long term operational conditions or not. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_PowerTransformervectorGroup"></a>11.11. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.vectorGroup`

**Title:** vectorGroup

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Vector group of the transformer for protective relaying, e.g., Dyn1. For unbalanced transformers, this may not be simply determined from the constituent winding connections and phase angle displacements.

The vectorGroup string consists of the following components in the order listed: high voltage winding connection, mid voltage winding connection (for three winding transformers), phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11,  low voltage winding connection 
phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11.   The winding connections are D (delta), Y (wye), YN (wye with neutral), Z (zigzag), ZN (zigzag with neutral), A (auto transformer). Upper case means the high voltage, lower case mid or low. The high voltage winding always has clock position 0 and is not included in the vector group string.  Some examples: YNy0 (two winding wye to wye with no phase displacement), YNd11 (two winding wye to delta with 330 degrees phase displacement), YNyn0d5 (three winding transformer wye with neutral high voltage, wye with neutral mid voltage and no phase displacement, delta low voltage with 150 degrees displacement).

Phase displacement is defined as the angular difference between the phasors representing the voltages between the neutral point (real or imaginary) and the corresponding terminals of two windings, a positive sequence voltage system being applied to the high-voltage terminals, following each other in alphabetical sequence if they are lettered, or in numerical sequence if they are numbered: the phasors are assumed to rotate in a counter-clockwise sense.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_Equipmentaggregate"></a>11.12. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>11.13. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>11.14. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_EquipmentinService"></a>11.15. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

### <a name="PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>11.17. Property `ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.
